comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: From what I can see, this Augustowa (one of several places in Poland with the name) is at roughly 53.85N,23.02E, south of Suwalki, southeast of Olecko (aka Marggrabowa) and northwest of Grodno (now Hrodna, in Belarus). www.travelmath.com/cities-near/Augustow,+Poland

comment.author: 14725550@N04
comment._content: This photo was taken in Augustów (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/August%C3%B3w) in former Russian barracks, probably in February 1915 during or after Second Battle of the Masurian Lakes (en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Second_Battle_of_the_Masurian_Lakes). Russian 20th Army Corps was surrounded by the Germans in the Augustow Forest. Barrack's buildings still exist: commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/Category:Former_barracks_in_Au..., but I'm not sure, if exactly this from the photo. This image was released several times as German military postcards. There are many others German photos showing fights in this region.
